title: Ticket #4616: DAGMan parse code doesn't always check for strtok() returning NULL
description:
Coverity complained about it here, but there are other places, too (in parse.cpp); 

  -423static bool
  -424parse_subdag( Dag *dag, Job::job_type_t nodeType,
  -425                        const char* nodeTypeKeyword,
  -426                        const char* dagFile, int lineNum,
    const char *directory )
  -427{
  CID 10533: Dereference null return value (NULL_RETURNS)Function "strtok"
  returns null (checked 60 out of 75 times).
  Assigning: "inlineOrExt" = null return value from "strtok".
  -428        const char *inlineOrExt = strtok( NULL, DELIMITERS );
  Dereferencing a pointer that might be null "inlineOrExt" when calling
  "strcasecmp". (The dereference is assumed on the basis of the 'nonnull'
  parameter attribute.)
  -429        if ( !strcasecmp( inlineOrExt, "EXTERNAL" ) ) {
  -430                return parse_node( dag, nodeType, nodeTypeKeyword,
    dagFile,
  -431                                        lineNum, directory,
    " EXTERNAL", "dagfile" );
  -432        }
  -433
  -434        debug_printf( DEBUG_QUIET, "ERROR: %s (line %d): only SUBDAG "
  -435                                "EXTERNAL is supported at this time\n",
    dagFile, lineNum);
  -436        return false;
  -437}
  -438

(Note: dashes in front of line numbers are needed to get gittrac formatting to work.)
